dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is circa 1985.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi and Marcus finish making love. Marcus has cerebral pal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want to hear my short          story now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts a MS from a shelf by his bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I changed the ending a          little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, it's the same, but  longer. I think it's better.  More...raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, maybe you should just          read the ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it won't make any sense if you  hear it out of context.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should leave it the          way it was. It was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't want to hear my new          ending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll read it in class tomorrow.          Surprise me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I have to go. I promised          Melinda I'd help her with her  oral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises, starts dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tired of me. I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, I'm tired. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lost interest...You hardly          even sweat any more when we  have sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never much of a sweater. You  know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Vi, I don't blame you. You          feel You feel pity now. The  pleasure isn't there any more. The  kinkiness has gone...You've  become kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is bright and sunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Scott, who is black, presides over his class. Marcus i reading from his story, Vi at his side. Catherine, a stun intellectual, sits near the teacher. The rest of the stud (Amy, Elli, etc.) listen closely and take notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...but when he saw her...it was          as if he could walk like a  normal person. His legs didn't          swing, his arms didn't spaz  away...He wasn't a freak any more,  for she made him forget his  affliction. No more cerebral          palsy! From now on  "CP" stood  for...cerebral person. He was a          cerebral person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Marcus and Vi exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was really good,          Marcus...Really moving and  emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought it was really          emotional, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I mean, really good word          choices. It kind of reminded me a  little of Faulkner, but East Coast  and disabled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Flannery O'Connor. She had          multiple sclerosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Borges. He was blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Updike has psoriasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...Maybe I'm wrong, but, um, I'm  afraid I found the whole thing to          be a little trite. Its earnestness  is, well...it's a little          embarrassing. And those  adjectives, they're a little          flatfooted. And redundant. I'm          sorry, but...Anyway, what do I          know? Don't even listen to what I          say. I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine is right. The story's a          piece of shit. You express nothing  but banalities and, formally          speaking, are unable to construct          a single compelling sentence. You          ride on a wave of clichГ©s so worn,  in fact, it actually approaches a          level of grotesquerie. Ad your          subtitle, 'the rawness of truth'          is that supposed to be a joke of          some sort? Or are you just being          pretentious? (beat; then checking his class book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, upset, rushes outside, Vi in pursuit, desperately console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so upset. It's OK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking          about? What's OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he hated my story also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your story was terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves on, she keeps up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus...You'll write something          better next time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patronizing fuck! If you had just          been honest with me in the first          place I wouldn't have read it. I          knew it was shit. But - idiot! - I  believed you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair! I was honest!          Just because I wasn't sucking up          like         that bitch Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I sure didn't hear you voice  your opinion in there when it          mattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit it - I was scared! I was          shocked, in fact , by what he          said. And he's so...convincing.          I'm sorry if I let you down, but          really, I still say he's just          one opinion. I don't even like his  books that much. They're all so          aggressively confrontational. I          don't care if he's won the          Pulitzer Prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Mr Scott walk by together in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want to fuck him. Like          Catherine and every other white          cunt on campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melinda lies on her bed with some homework, watching Vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But Marcus! You can't just          unilaterally decide to end things.  This is a relationship we're          talking about! A friendship! You          don't just...Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and enters her bedroom, in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VI(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him! Fuck him! Fuck him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi? Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm OK. I'm totally OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melinda rises, puts a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. Fucking cripple. Why          do I waste my time with          undergrads? They're all          so...juvenile! Uch! I just thought  Marcus would be different. I          mean he's got CP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...go to a bar...get          laid...whatever...Don't worry          about me. I'll be fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts changing into a new outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students hang around outside. Vi goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi walks up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After getting her beer, Vi turns around and suddenly noti who is sitting alone. She goes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VI(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean, I just          didn't expect to run into you          here, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi laughs, sort of, ten blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, then...are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I join you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Scott gestures for her to sit down with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VI(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks. Well, um...I just          wanted to say that I'm really          happy with the class and,          um...I know you must here this all  the time, but I'm also a          great admirer of your work. A          Sunday Lynching,          especially...really, um spoke to          me. God, I hope I'm not          embarrassing you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I...um...I really agreed          with everything you had to say          last week about how bad my story          was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I also agreed with what you          said today about Marcus's story.          It is a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have beautiful skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Catherine seems like she might          become a really good writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. She's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going out with          Catherine? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's none of my          business. I didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not 'going out' with          Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I have a potential as  a writer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for being honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Scott leans over and touches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have so much respect for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Scott and Vi walk together in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi and Mr Scott enter. He turns around and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just freshen up for a          second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the direction of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi enters, locks the door behind her. She looks at hersel mirror, then notices a snapshot of Catherine: she is nake wide. Other erotic photographs lie beneath Catherine's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself, almost chanting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a racist. Don't be a          racist. Don't be a racist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi emerges from the bathroom to find Mr Scott lounging on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a really nice place you have.  Is the rent high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...take off the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does, and he looks hard at her. Finally he rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bend over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts making love to her, from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR SCOTT(cont'd) (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, 'nigger, fuck me.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, bu...uh...I can't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Ni...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ni...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...gger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...gger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, 'Nigger.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fuck me hard!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me hard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, 'Nigger, fuck me hard!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigger, fuck me hard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigger, fuck me hard!!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights are out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus looks in the mirror, ponders his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a soft knock at the door. He turns  away from th opens it. Vi is there, teary-eyed, disheveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all...sweaty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi finishes reading her story to the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...So John flipped her around and  slammed her against the wall. Jane  braced herself: she thought about          her mother. She thought about          Peter. She thought about God...and  rape. ''Say, 'Fuck me, nigger.          Fuck me hard.''' John's flesh          abraded her soft skin. There would  be marks. She acquiesced, and said  what he asked her to say, and did          what he asked her to do. She had          entered college with hope, with          dignity, but she would graduate as  a whore.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people have to be so          ugly...write about such ugly          characters? It's perverted. I know  you all think I'm being prisssy,          but I don't care. I was brought up  in a certain way. And this          is...mean-spirited!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it did seem a little          affected. Like by using taboo          language you were trying to shock          us about the hollowness of your          characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was a little bit          racist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was completely racist, and          beyond that I felt deeply offended  as a         woman. As if a woman can          only operate from experiences of          objectification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally phallocentric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so weirdly misogynistic. I          mean, why does Jane go through          with this? Is she stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, But wasn't this a rape? Or          ...did I miss something? Because I  - I'm confused. Because if this          was a rape, then why would she be          a whore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was confessional, yet          dishonest. Jane pretends to be          horrified by         the sexuality that          she in fact fetishizes. She          subsumes herself to the myth of          black male potency, but then          doesn't follow through. She thinks  she 'respects Afro-Americans,' she  thinks they're 'cool,' 'exotic,'          what a notch he 'd make in her  belt, but, of course, it all comes  down to mandingo clichГ©, and he          calls her on it. In classic racist  tradition she demonizes, then runs  for cover. But then, how could she  behave otherwise? She's just a          spoiled suburban white girl with a  Benneton rainbow complex. It's          just my opinion, and what do I          know...but I think it's a callow          piece of writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callow and coy. Jane wants more,          but isn't honest enough to admit          it. In the end, she returns to the  safety of her crippled          (translation: sexually impotent)          boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! Her story was          the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unbelievable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clichГ©d!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about 'what          happened,' Vi, because once you          start writing, it  all becomes          fiction. Still, it certainly is an  improvement over your last story:          There is now at least a beginning,  a middle, and an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lower East Side tenement apartment. A dogma '95 poster the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby, down and out and in his thirties, leafs through his yearbook. He reads an inscription: 'Toby, I just know you become a movie star! Please don't forget me when you make top! I will always love you - Pam'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, is this Pam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Oxman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby -? Oh, hi! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fine. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was gonna ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, well...um...I was just          calling because, well, I was          wondering if you still remembered          me, which I guess you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Look at where we are: the year  2000! Can you believe it? I mean,          did you ever think we would          actually make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well, yeah. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you still acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, not any more. No, um, I          kind of came to terms with myself,  I realized I had done what I had          to do. And it was time to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. So what did you do after you          gave up on acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I went to law school, if you  can believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Toby's roommate and cameraman, enters looking for a goes to take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it was really all kind  of a joke - and a rip-off, so,          uh...so I dropped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, then it got me          writing, so that was a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I might know about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, um, I kind of let things go          on this novel I'd been really into  - I mean, the whole publishing          industry is totally corrupt. I          mean, really, it's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked over at a homeless          shelter for a while, drove a cab          to pay the rent, but, I mean, that  was like - I mean, I have some          dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. So then what do you          do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a documentary filmmaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Anything I might have seen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-not yet. I'm hoping to get a          grant for this one project on          teenagers. Geez, remember when we          were teenagers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You didn't wanna take me to          the prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't remember that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, but it was so long ago. We          were so different back then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well, anyway, so I'm looking          for subjects for this documentary          on teenage life in suburbia. Kind          of an exploration of the mental          psyche of its mythology. I wrote          to Derrida to see if he'd like to          do the narration. But everything's  still kind of in development at          this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY(beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work in a shoe store right now.          But it's cool. I'm not ashamed. I          mean, really, I have a much          stronger sense of self now. And,          uh, anyways, it's really very          temporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...um...so anyway, tell me.          What about you? I'd heard through          the grapevine you were producing          movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But not any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Tired of 'life in the fast          lane'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...So you're um...you're          married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. How old are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight, six, and four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that really is great. In a          few years, who knows, maybe          they'll want to be in my          documentary! Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Toby, I can't really talk          right now. Do you mind if I call          you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, after pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she has caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is bright and shiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any hobbies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby, seventeen, and Mr DeMarco, the guidance counselor each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any books you like to read for          fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None at all? How about those          'underground' comics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Scooby, let's not beat          around the bush. With your          attitude, you're not going to get          in anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'OK.' So you just don't care. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you, not as your          guidance counselor, but...as a          friend: what do you want to          do with your life? I mean, what          kind of long-term goals can you          possibly have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Talk to me. Tell me what          you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean...I wanna be on TV.          Maybe have a talk show or          something. Like Conan. Or early          Letterman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-hah. And how is it you hope to          achieve this goal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. See if I have any          connections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprinkler system is still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is sitting waiting at the table: FERN, Scooby' mother; MARTY, his bullish father; BRADY, sixteen, his ha brother; and MIKEY, ten his smart youngest brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONSUELO, the maid, brings some bread to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you knock on his door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but he just shouted at me and  used the f-word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby! Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would anyone be interested in          being hypnotized after dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's wrong with          that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's vegetarian, doesn't do          sports...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even if he is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gay people are people too, you          know. You're just being          prejudiced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care is he's gay. I'm          cool. I mean, it's not like I have  to share his room or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to know what the hell          he's doing in his room that's so          interesting he doesn't come down          for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's building a bomb...just          like-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even joke about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious! What happens if he          blows up the school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense pause, followed by a distant crushing sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was anyone in my room today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My CD case like totally collapsed.  I'm gonna have to recatalogue all          weekend.  (sitting down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Can you pass the salad over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steak's really good tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a lot of homework?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean you don't know? You          either got a lot or you don't.          What's not to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You started filling out your          college applications yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What DO you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm trying to figure things          out right now, OK? It's like,          really hard, and I'm just          listening to some old Elton John          and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady mouths: 'Gay!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out! Leave the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me: leave the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I am out of here! This family  is so fucked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's not fair if Brady can          say the f-word and I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Mikey, listen up.          Cause here's a lesson: life's not          fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red sports car drives up front. Esposito, Brady's buddy Brady and Cheryl, Brady's cheerleader girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cleaning woman walks along the sidewalk on her way to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to you later, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Esposito!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady, still in his football outfit, tracks in some dirt. follows him to his room, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey sits on the sofa while Consuelo continues her house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mikey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any brothers or          sisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four brothers and five sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did your parents have so many          children? I mean, if they were  poor, wouldn't it be better to  have just one or two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was God's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But do you really believe in God?          And heaven, hell and angels and          all kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Livingstons are eating dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? How was school today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same. Same as what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're studying the Holocaust in          Social Studies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did the same thing last year          also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm supposed to watch          Schindler's List for homework. The  movie's like almost four hours.          And then I'm supposed to write a          report on survivors. (to Marty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know any survivors, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...Do I know          any...personally...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically your Zeda is a          survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in a concentration camp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. But he had to escape the  Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought he came over to          America before the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he did. With his family. But  his cousins, they had to stay and          they were all killed. And if he'd          stayed, he would have been killed.  So in my book he's a survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though it was only his          cousins that were killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that could've happened to him.  Or to me, if I'd been alive. Or          you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, then, we're all          survivors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...yes. If it hadn't been for          Hitler, he wouldn't have had to          leave Europe. We would have          been...European.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, in a sense, since you          would never have met Dad if your          family had stayed in Europe...if          it weren't for Hitler, none of us          would have been born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's just, like,          conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby sits across from Mr Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me: you make a living at          this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir...uh...I'm actually not          doing this for the money. When you  make a documentary, you do it for          many reasons, but money is          certainly not one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, a lot has happened to          the landscape of the suburban high  school since I was a student, and          I feel it would be a valuable,          perhaps even enlightening          endeavor, to chronicle the          changes, to get intimate with the          realities kids and parents face in  American schools today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, whatever. I'll let you  know if there's interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby pauses by the receptionist before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby rushes to the urinal. Scooby is sitting in a corner, joint, observing him. Toby smells the pot, turns and smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a pervert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Actually, I'm a documentary          filmmaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You mean, like, Blair Witch          Project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. I'm doing one on high          school students, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it's kind of a sociological  study in the aftermath of          Columbine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this to like get into Sundance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's possible they          would be interested in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, there is some interest          from the Sundance Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoopee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HBO and MTV have also shown some          interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have connections...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, we're trying to do a film  on suburban lifestyles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby sits in the living room surrounded by the Livingston

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty fingers a card that reads: TOBY OXMAN, DOCUMENTARIA and phone number are printed below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...kind of An American Family for          the new millennium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was about kids          getting into college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it is. I mean В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is it? You gotta keep your          focus straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're absolutely right. The focus  is on the college admissions          process today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you want Scooby to be the          focus of all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby and a few other students of  different socioeconomic          backgrounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, I don't have them yet,          but В–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either Scooby is the focus, or          forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought I was the focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be the focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby, we need this to be a          positive experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose I could          reconceive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reconceive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause Scooby does have a quality          that I've been looking for, a          quality that is emblematic of          American today. It's part          disillusionment, part hope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo comes in with tea and Twinkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twinkeys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, take napkins...Napkins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to be crass, but what do we          get out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he doesn't mean          money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know, I know that. Well,          sharing your story, your ups and          downs, and so  forth, can I hope, be an          illuminating experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...How do we know we won't be          exploited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Livingston, I fully understand          and I share your concerns. You          fell vulnerable. And I know that          this is a very difficult question,  but what it comes down to is: can          you make a leap of faith in me, in  the same way that I have to make a  leap of faith in you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Esposito, in football attire, surrounded by Brady and athletes, talks to Toby. Kids whip towels at each other i background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a great school. I don't          care what anybody says. I mean,          it's not perfect, but like the          people are really cool, like the          teachers and kids...they really          care and all. And I know that they  make fun of New Jersey all the          time, but I don't care. 'Cause           they're just snobs. 'Cause Jersey          is where America's at!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking down these hallways just          like the ones I once walked down          as a teenager, I couldn't help          thinking back to a time when every  day I woke up depressed, suicidal,  consumed by despair. Had things          changed? Was the competition to          get into the most prestigious          schools still a requisite rite of          passage? Beneath these masks of          courtesy and friendliness I knew          that there were darker forces at          work...and I knew that Scooby was          the key to revealing the truth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...looking pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby, Scooby, Scooby...What are          you thinking? College, SATs, your          parents, your brothers, your          friends...How is it you deal with          all this stress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A school psychologist sits at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pressure to get into the          college of your choice is          incredible. You know, they did a          study recently of the youth in          Bosnia during the bombing, and          they found that the stress the          young people experienced there was  less than what American high- school students go through when          applying to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and his editor examine the footage on an AVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whaddya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not really sure what          you're trying to say. It's funny,          I suppose. But it seems glib and          facile to just make fun of how          idiotic these people are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not making fun. I'm showing it  as it really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're showing how superior you          are to your subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I like my subject. I like          these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. I love them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camerawork's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'll tell Mike. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's still just a beginning.  I know I can...dig deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is bright and sunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fern is in the kitchen talking on the phone. She has a li and notes in front of her. Consuelo dusts in the backgrou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Mike stand nearby with a video camera, recording

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Marj В– may I call you Marj?  В– what it really boils down to          is...what does it mean to be a          Jew?...Exactly. Tzedakah. Charity.  And the new wing at Beth Israel          is...Well, actually, last year you  gave $500. But this year $1,000          would not only be a mitzvah, it          would bring you to a new          level...Yes, of course. Your gift          would also give you a Chagall          menorah and two tickets to the          dinner dance this spring...Because  it's true: Israel needs us now. If  not now, when?...Well, that's          wonderful...I'll speak to you next  week...You too! Take care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up just as Scooby walks inside, fresh from scho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Scooby! How was school today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SATs, knucklehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is eating dinner. There is a tense silence, fi by Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mikey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking through Scooby's          SATs practice books this afternoon  and I took one of the practice          tests. Guess what score I got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 550 verbal, 520 math. And I'm only  in fifth grade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby is brushing his teeth when Marty enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya wanna talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't screw around with me. You          know what I'm talking about. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking those SATs. You're          taking those SATs or your CD          collection is history. You're          taking those SATs and you're going  to college. You're taking those          SATs if I have to strap your ass          to a chair, but buddy your taking          them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath as he starts walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired of this shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Mike shoot footage of the students as they take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby is filling out his SAT in such a way that he creat of filled blanks that spells: FUCK THIS SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Mike are interviewing Brady and Cheryl in the dr the side, Mikey tries hypnotizing a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you surprised that Scooby          took the SATs after all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. He's kind of a wuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. How about you, Cheryl? Were          you surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how come you drive such a          shitty car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joins their laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...That's interesting,  though. A cool car. Is that          something that's real important to  you, Brady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby handles a gun his friend Stanley has given him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty cool, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my Dad's He hides it under          some old TV Guides in his closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, your Dad's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it loaded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby points it at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby, don't! Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an idiot, man. I watch TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Know. I'm sorry. I'm just...a          little nervous, I don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby points it at Stanley, gets a terrified reaction, t gun aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. You can keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies down. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Everyone knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that you'd let          me...um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. If you feel like it. Just give  me a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a bag of mushrooms out from beneath his night ta some and offers to Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby flicks on a CD, then lies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Stanley goes down on Scooby, the camera pans away f reveal Marty and Fern being burned at the stake in the fr writhing and screaming in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry! I should never have          made you take the SATs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera then pans to reveal Conan O'Brien approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Scooby! How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan O'Brien? Whoa! What are you          doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a last-minute          guest for my show. Any          suggestions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be your guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well, all right! Let's          take a look at the television and          see how we look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans to reveal a TV standing on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns on the TV and we move inside it to see Conan sharing some talk-show patter and repartee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the show, Scooby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to have you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thank you for dressing up for          us. This is very classy. Tell us.          What kind of professional plans do  you have? What's in your future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking...I might          work for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh...tell me. What do you want to  do for me? What's your idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be your sidekick, you know, and          maybe eventually become a TV talk- show host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV talk-show host, OK. You were at  sidekick eight seconds ago, then          TV talk-show host. You'll be a          Latin dictator in a bout a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what they think of the          first idea. I'm curious          what the audience thinks. Folks,          what do you think: should Scooby          be my new sidekick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby, new sidekick, everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bigger round of applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby has spaced out while flossing. There is a knock at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need to talk          about with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some rumors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...Stanley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like, don't take this the          wrong way...I mean, I'm          cool...but...you  know...I've got a good reputation          at school and, well...I really          don't want it ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is visibly upset. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prob. I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Scoob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A football scrimmage is in progress. A play ends, and the on to the field, barking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esposito, What the fuck do you          think you're doing? You're          tackling like a bitch  on my football team, son! You          gotta bend your ass over and hit          somebody! You understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do it!...Livingston! That's          the way to hit that hole, son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady waves a Cheryl in the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna become a football team  today, guys! Let's move the ball!          Move! Move! Move! I wanna see you          hit those holes! Defense, fill          those goddam gaps! Let's go, guys!  Let's do it!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the next play Brady runs to catch a pass, but is moved Esposito  shouting, 'KILL HIM!!!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheryl jumps up, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. cheerleaders finish their 'Go Bucks!' cheer, but Bra rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady lies unconscious in bed, hooked up to machines. Mar Scooby, and Cheryl stand around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey sits at the kitchen table with Consuelo. He is eati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm in high school I'm not          going to play any football. I'm          just going to concentrate on class  rank. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do in high school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not go to high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't there high schools in El          Salvador?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to work. My family was          poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been hard being poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Consuelo, even though your          poor, don't you have any hobbies          or interests or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But like, what do you like to do          when you're not working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when you're not. Like now.          What do you like to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not like real work. This          is just babysitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo stares hard at him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your job's really not so  bad, if you think about it. You          should smile more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (1) Driving-along-the-neighborhood shots; a lam post; a s floating straw wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the sky is clear and the sun          is warm, you're reminded of how          beautiful things can be: a lamp          post, a sign, a straw wrapper          blowing in the windВ…But when that          dark cloud appears, you realize          how fragile the balance of life          is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (2) The neurologist Dr Barry Jordan discussing Brady's co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Brady first arrived at the          hospital he was unresponsive to          verbal stimuli. Wee performed a CT  scan which demonstrated a large          subdural hemotoma with mass          effect. Since the removal of the          subdural he's been in coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (3) A psychologist discussing the effect of the Brady cri family:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first met the Livingstons          it was in the first twenty four          hours of Brady coming in after his  tragic football accident and they          were acting in a fairly typical          wayВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (4) The Livingstons consulting with Dr Goodman in a hospi room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not the ones who need the          help. My son needs help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son's in there! He can't even          feed himself, he can't eat В– I          don't even know if he's going to          be a vegetable or not, for          Chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture freezes and then zooms into a close up on Sco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about Scooby? How would          this effect him? What meaning is          to be found in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and his editor finish watching this latest footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is definitely better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so? You don't think that  this might not be a little dry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is entertainment you're          making, Toby. This story about a          kid in the suburbs and the state          of the college admissions process          has, with this Brady crisis,          evolved into something much richer  and more provocative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I knowВ…But still, it should          be somewhat entertaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, without this footage,          without this rigorous          documentation, it would feel          like exploitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. No exploitation. This          is seriousВ…But don't you find it a  little funny too, at the same          time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a family tragedy on          your hands. Will you tell me          what's funny about that? About a          kid in a coma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, I guessВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, why are you making this          documentary if you can't treat          your subject with appropriate          gravity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, you're right, you're rightВ… (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we need to screen what          we've gotВ…invite some regular          people, just some random off-the- street typesВ…and see what real          people think of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, Toby. We really have a          long way to go. You still need a          lot more footage, and it's          probably a little premature to          start screeningВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, then we can invite serious          intellectual types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hip alternative types who will          understand the process betterВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I need to see this with an          audience!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's an audience going to tell          you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe they'll like          it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey opens the refrigerator, takes out a bottle of grape a cup for himself, then accidentally spills it all on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo! I spilled some grape          juice on the floor!В…Consuelo?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey goes downstairs, finds her alone in her bedroom. Sh be upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo. Are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. I can tell. What's          the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi JesusВ…mi jesusВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi Jesus esta muerto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo, I'm sorry, but you know          if you don't speak English I can't  understand you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My JesusВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Jesus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a bay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandchild-baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I didn't even know you had          any children. But why are you so          upset about Jesus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was executed. He was on Death          Row and then he was executed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they execute him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's for the bestВ…I mean, if  he was guilty of doing  something          wrongВ…People who are bad should be  killed. Don't you think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus was not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he was and you just didn't          know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still, you can't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But really, you never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was he on Death Row?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For rape and murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo, what is rape exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is when you love someone, and          they don't love you. And then you          do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I feel like my parents          don't love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, when you get older you          can do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo? I spilled some grape          juice upstairs. Do you think you          could clean up the floor now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Mikey sit by the comatose Brady, who lies now i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?В…Do you think that Brady will          ever get better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One in a million recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's that one in a million!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey, there's optimism, and then          there's stupidity. It's a very          fine line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there's any hope,          either. I was just trying to make          you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?В…Would you let me try          hypnotizing you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure Go ahead. Hypnotize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Stay there. I'll be right          back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey hurries off to fetch his hypnotizing apparatus. Mar waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sec!В…Be right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey returns, sets himself up across from Marty and take object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, can you turn around a bit,          please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. All right. Now you must          look at this shiny object and          concentrate. Relax your legs.          Relax your arms. Relax your          shoulders. Now keep your eyes on          the shiny objectВ…Your eyelids          are getting heavyВ…heavierВ…You're          getting sleepyВ…sleepierВ…Now let          your eyes close shutВ…and you          are asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty's head drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are completely under my          power. I am the only voice you can  hear, the only voice you will          listen to. Now. When you wake up          you will be in a good mood. You          won't worry so much about Brady.          And I will be your favorite from          now on. If Brady dies, you can be          sad for a little bit, but I will          still be the most important person  in your life. You will never be          mean to me, and always give me          whatever I want. Also, you should          fire Consuelo. She's lazy. Now          when I snap my fingers, you will          remember nothing, but you will do          everything I have asked. One. Two.  Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey snaps his fingers and Marty wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mikey. You wanna get some ice  cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of maids are walking by with white babies in str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So like, yeahВ…I caved in. I mean,          I had to. My parents, they're like  В…still really depressed about          Brady. So I wrote the bullshit          essay. Filled out the          applications, did the          interviewsВ…Y'know, I figure I can          always drop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where'd you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prnceton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what did you get on your SATs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 verbal/710 math. Kinda weird,          I know. But I think they thought          it was, like, good-weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Fern sit on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you have to. Sometimes          you just have to, Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what kind of pull did you          have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a cousin. Very big giver to  the alumni fund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about who you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're not suckers. Everyone          else is out there doing the same          thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby watches Toby and Mike as they try fixing their jam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, TobyВ…This thing won't open          again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me try it, let me try it. (takes camera from Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's umВ…The button is just stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, um, Toby? I was wonderingВ…Is          the documentary almost finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, we're getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see what you have so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SureВ…umВ…yeah, as soon as I have a          screening I'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey and Consuelo are playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin! I win! Let's play again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts dealing another round when Marty suddenly appea work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mikey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, give me a hug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, you're home early!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh, listen. Why don't you go  upstairs and keep your Mom and          Brady company for a bit? I need to  speak alone with Consuelo for a          moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs up the stairs, pretends to disappear, but stays t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo. Mrs. Livingston and I have discussed this, and the conclusion that we are not very happy with your work we're going to let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been happy with you in the          past, but now we think maybe it's          time for a changeВ…uhВ…I know you've  had trouble at home and maybe, you  know, some of that is reflected I          your workВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr Livingston, I work very          hard for you and your family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, I understand that,          and I'm sorry it had to end this          way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo exits the house and trudges towards the bus stop her belongings. Other cleaning women are waiting for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby is looking at the address on Toby's 'documentarian card. He picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, the store manager, leaves a costumer for a moment t phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florsheim. Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. IВ…uh...I'm trying to reach          Toby Oxman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, he's off today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В…on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OKВ…umВ…Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby drives his Mom's shiny new SUV to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby pulls into a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby climbs a stairwell, rings a bell. Mike opens the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, Mike. Is Toby here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Do you have any idea where he          might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's at a test screening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby hurries outside only to find his car stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby rides a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby sees a sign that reads: 'American Scooby: test scr goes into the screening room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В…of the documentary being screened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty talks to Toby poolside as he prepares a barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Scooby's like a lot of          kids. He just hit aВ…a speed bump.          Now he's gonna find his way, his          path is gonna be cleared, and I          think he's gonna continue his          education at a good college. And          everybody else is gonna be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But Mr Livingston, aren't you a  bit fearful that Scooby will be          confronted with hollow values and          systemic conformism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why this is so hard          for you to comprehend. I had a          terrific time in college. I've got  a terrific job, a comfortable          salary, terrific wife, three          terrific kidsВ…and every year I          give to the alumni fund. Now why          are you trying to make college out  to be a bad thing, a negative          experience? You were unhappy?          Well, to bad! Get over it! Stop          trying to impose your misery on          others by going around saying,          'Life is bad, life is horrible.'          Life is tough on you? Well, boo          hoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby talks to Toby in the Backyard, Marty seen in the d background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, yeah, my Dad is kind of a  goofball. I just have to pretend          to go along with his ideas. 'Cause  he really doesn't get it: like I          could be the next Oprah, for all          he knows, but he's never even seen  the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...watching himself on screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he continues talking to Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is most important to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I'd like to be good at          something. It doesn't have to be          TV. I mean, it could be          movies...Anything. I'd be willing          to direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd like to be, you          know...famous. Not necessarily a          superstar, just famous. Be          recognized. Get fan Mail.          Things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...still talking to Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Scooby, now I understand how          you want to be a TV talk-show host  and all, like Conan O'Brien, but          did you know even he went to          college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He went to Harward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...watching the film and listening to the audience. The l of control. He is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Fern are in bed watching the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Dad? Can I sleep with you?          I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flick off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, honey. Come in bed with  us. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey gets in bed with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snug as a bug in a rug. Yeah, here  you go, pal. All righty...You're          monster-proofed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo approaches the house stealthily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...opening the back of the house;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stuffing towels under bedroom doors;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turning on the kitchen stove's gas;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: switching on the main gas valve in the boiler room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consuelo flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby gets off the bus with a few cleaning women. He wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooby sees reporters, policemen, firemen, ambulances, ga vehicles, and neighbors surrounding his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby and Mike suddenly appear with their camera trained o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, Scooby! I'm so          sorry...I'm so, so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. Your movie's a hit.
